info.name: ‚û°Ô∏è [ASPS] Easy Ship Order Processing - Fulfillment Deep Dive
info.description: ### üß© Welcome to the Easy Ship challenge! --- #### **Problem** üö©**:** Your goal is to help Harsh automate his _Easy Ship_ order processing, **ASAP**!, as customers are already sending him orders! #### Current Status ü™´: Harsh has already created all the requests necessary for the order processing. However, some requests are still using placeholders or might have some wrong values within the parameters or the request body. #### Goal ü•Ö : Finish the integration and generate the first _Easy Ship_ shipping label for Harsh's pending order so that he can ship the packages to the customer in good time! #### Your Job üè¢: As an Easy Ship and Smart Connect expert, help Harsh: 1. Check the collection and the 5 steps needed. 2. Inspect the parameters to detect any missing or wrong values. All the requests must succeed and return the 200 status. 3. Move from one step to the next until you reach step 5: the final step 4. Download the shipping label 5. Be first and be the winner! Send the password on the shipping label ASAP to Harsh at [sp-api-harsh-challenge@amazon.com](https://mailto:sp-api-harsh-challenge@amazon.com) and use your name as email subject.

item.name: üõí Step 1. Fetch open Easy Ship orders üõí

query.description: (Required) Retrieves only those shipments which are in the specified status. The most common use-case would be to fetch all new shipments which would be in the ACCEPTED status. Valid values are ACCEPTED, CONFIRMED, PACKAGE_CREATED, PICKUP_SLOT_RETRIEVED, INVOICE_GENERATED, SHIPLABEL_GENERATED, SHIPPED, DELIVERED and CANCELLED.
The channel name associated with the location.
The marketplace name associated with the location.
The Amazon location identifier for which shipments are to be retrieved
Shipments whose latest update is after the specified date/time are included in the response. This field should be in the ISO8601 date/time format.
Shipments whose latest update is before the specified date/time are included in the response. This field should be in the ISO8601 date/time format.
Specify the maximum number of shipments to be included in the response.
The nextToken value returned from a previous call to get shipments. Use this to retrieve the next page of shipments.

request.description: Get a list of shipments dropped for the seller in the specified status. Shipments can be further filtered based on the fulfillment node and/or shipments' last updated date and time.

query.description: (Required) The status in which shipment should be moved.

variable.description: (Required) The id of the shipment which is to be confirmed for fulfillment.

request.description: Confirms/Rejects that a seller will be fulfilling or cancelling the specified shipment.

variable.description: (Required) The id of the shipment for which package information is being provided.

request.description: Provides details about the packages that will be used to fulfill the specified shipment.

query.description: (Required) The id of the shipment for which available shipping option needs to be fetched.
(Required) The id of the package for which available shipping option needs to be fetched.

request.description: An API for a client to retrieve an optional list of shippingOptions that marketplace/channel provides for the pickup of the packages of an shipment. This API will return a list of shippingOptions if the marketplace/channel provides transportation and allows the seller to choose a shippingOption. If the marketplace/channel does not allow for a shippingOption to be selected, but has a pre-determined shippingOption, then this API will return an empty response.

query.description: The URL encoded id of the shippingOption for which the ship-labels are to be generated and retrieved. Only required for MFN channel.
(Required) The operation which says it is generation or regeneration of label.

variable.description: (Required) The id of the shipment whose ship-labels are to be generated and retrieved.

request.description: Generates and retrieves all ship-labels for one or more packages in the specified shipment.
